intro: Atriplex patula var. japonica, commonly known as Japanese saltbush, is a shrub native to East Asia. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that are adapted to arid and saline environments. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in compact clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or desert regions. Its ability to tolerate high salinity makes it a valuable plant for ecological restoration projects.
